feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued March 02 at 8:00AM AKST until March 02 at 11:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM AKST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Central Interior. * WHEN...Until 11 AM AKST this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued March 02 at 8:00AM AKST until March 02 at 11:00AM AKST by NWS

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued March 02 at 4:25AM AKST until March 03 at 11:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 40 to 60 mph with gusts up to 75 mph possible. * WHERE...Eastern Aleutians. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 3:50PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Storm Impacting West Coast of Alaska Friday... A strong storm bringing winds, snow and blowing snow will move north over the West Coast of Alaska on Friday. There is a possibility that this storm could bring blizzard conditions to the West Coast Friday into Saturday. This could also bring a slight chance of freezing rain to areas south of Nome on Friday.

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued March 02 at 2:20AM MST until March 04 at 6:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW RH AND A HIGH TO VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR PARTS OF FIRE WEATHER ZONES 151, 152, AND 154... The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from late Friday morning through Friday afternoon.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued March 02 at 8:10AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LOW SPRING FLOOD THREAT ACROSS CALIFORNIA & NEVADA... The potential for flooding due to spring snowmelt in the California Nevada River Forecast Center`s domain is below normal due to below normal snowpack. Flooding in California remains a slight possibility due to the seasonal threat of heavy rainfall alone, or combined with snowmelt

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 6:40AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...COLDER CONDITIONS RETURN FRIDAY THROUGH THIS WEEKEND WITH SLICK ROADS POSSIBLE... Warm and dry conditions will continue through Thursday, but a series of weak weather systems will bring a return to colder winter conditions late Friday through this weekend. While some uncertainty remains for where snow falls especially by the

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued March 02 at 4:58AM PST until March 02 at 9:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves are expected due to elevated surf of 4 to 6 feet with local sets to 7 feet. Surf will be highest on west facing beaches. * WHERE...Ventura County Coast.

entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and rough surf of 3 to 5 feet. * WHERE...Northeast Florida Beaches. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 3:55AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER IN EFFECT FROM NOON EST TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING... Temperatures warming well into the 70s this afternoon will combine with a very dry air mass across Northeast Georgia to produce relative humidity values below 25 percent for several hours. Winds will be westerly at 5 to 10 mph. With fuels remaining

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 3:37AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH FIRE DANGER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING FOR PARTS OF NORTH AND CENTRAL GEORGIA DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES... entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued March 01 at 9:12PM AST until March 03 at 6:00AM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves of 6 to 9 feet. * WHERE...In Virgin Islands, northwest beaches of St. Thomas and St John. In Puerto Rico, most beaches of Culebra.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 6:08AM PST until March 02 at 11:04AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County. .No additional hydrologically significant rain is in the forecast for the next few days. The Cowlitz River at Randle will continue to recede through the day below flood stage.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 5:25AM PST until March 03 at 11:32AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington...Idaho... Palouse River near Potlatch affecting Latah and Whitman Counties. .Rain this morning and this afternoon is expected to push the Palouse River above flood stage this afternoon and evening. For the Palouse River...including Pullman, Potlatch...Minor flooding

entry.title: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 5:20AM PST until March 04 at 5:50PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .No additional hydrologically significant rain is in the forecast for the next few days. The flood crest on the Chehalis will arrive at Grand Mound late Wednesday morning and at Porter Thursday morning.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 5:18AM PST until March 02 at 11:04PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda affecting Thurston County. .Hydrologically significant rain came to an end Tuesday. Rain in the next couple of days will not result in any changes to the river levels.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 5:15AM PST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .Rain in the forecast through Thursday will not be enough to stop the Skokomish river from receding into the weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE...

entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... entry.title: Flood Watch issued March 01 at 9:29PM PST until March 02 at 11:04AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: .The Chehalis and Skookumchuck rivers continue to rise Tuesday evening and are not forecast to crest until Wednesday in Lewis county. The flood watch will remain in effect overnight. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 1:27PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAINFALL SUNDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING HAS LED TO AN INCREASED THREAT OF LANDSLIDES AND DEBRIS FLOWS IN WESTERN WASHINGTON... Rainfall of as much as 3 to 10 inches over the past 72 hours has increased soil moisture to high levels across western Washington. This amount of rain has put extra pressure on soil instability,

entry.summary: ...RISING RIVER LEVELS THROUGH MIDWEEK DUE TO RAIN AND HIGH SNOW LEVELS... For the Foothills of the northern Blue Mountains, the northern Blue Mountains and the Grande Ronde Valley. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 8:58AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS POSSIBLE THIS MORNING... Look for light snow showers across far northern Wisconsin during the morning hours. Snowfall accumulations could be a few tenths of an inch. The snow may cause roadways to become snow covered and slippery. Motorists should use caution when travelling this morning across far northern Wisconsin.
